title: Rich in aroma
caption: Rich in aroma
desc: Rich in aroma, the Gewürztraminer is a type of wine grape commonly used in white wine. It's sweet flavour tends to pair well with spicy foods. The origins of its name lie in the German word 'Gewürz' for spice and Traminer for a village in Italy. If you have a taste palette for wine, you can identify the use of the Gewürztraminer grape by its low acidity, wholesome texture and fruity flavours like peach, apricot and mango. A major characteristic is its sweet scent similar to lychee, grapefruit and rose petals. While these pink-skinned grapes are predominantly grown in France, they can also be found here at home, notably in Okanagan Valley, B.C.
